Item.title: Item
Item.description: Represents an item in the Sahachari Resource Tracker inventory.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Item entity.

category.description: The category the item belongs to.

description.description: A detailed description of the item.

quantity.description: The number of items currently in inventory.

imageUrl.description: URL of the item's image stored in Firebase Storage.

status.description: The current status of the item (Available, Issued, Returned, Pending Return).

dateAdded.description: The date and time the item was added to the inventory.

IssuedItem.title: IssuedItem
IssuedItem.description: Represents an item that has been issued to an individual.

id.description: Unique identifier for the IssuedItem entity.

issuedToName.description: The name of the person the item was issued to.

issuedToContact.description: Contact information (e.g., phone number, email) of the person the item was issued to.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expectedReturnDate.description: The expected date for the item to be returned.

actualReturnDate.description: The actual date the item was returned. Null if not yet returned.

WeeklyReport.title: WeeklyReport
WeeklyReport.description: Represents a weekly report on inventory activity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the WeeklyReport entity.

startDate.description: The start date of the week the report covers.

endDate.description: The end date of the week the report covers.

totalItemsAdded.description: The total number of items added during the week.

itemsIssued.description: The number of items issued during the week.

itemsReturned.description: The number of items returned during the week.

itemsPendingReturn.description: The number of items pending return at the end of the week.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to facilitate a secure and scalable inventory management system for the Sahachari Resource Tracker application. It emphasizes authorization independence through denormalization and structural segregation for clarity and security. The structure uses path-based ownership for user-related data and the membership map pattern for collaborative access where needed.

**Authorization Independence:**  No `get()` calls are required in security rules.  The `items` collection itself doesn't require an `ownerId` or `members` field, as public read access is permitted. The `issuedItems` subcollection includes denormalized fields like the `itemId` to allow for rules to ensure issues are valid and that reporting occurs.  Admin roles are managed through the `roles_admin` collection. This eliminates hierarchical authorization checks, ensuring atomic operations are possible.

**Structural Segregation:** The design separates data with different security postures into distinct collections. The `items` collection is public read, admin write; whereas `/roles_admin` is a secure existence-based admin role check. There is no mixing of public and private data.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The structure facilitates secure `list` operations by ensuring all documents within a collection share the same security requirements. Public `list` access to `/items` is safe because all items are intended to be readable by all users. Admin `list` access can be secured via DBAC in the `roles_admin` collection.
